intro: Bursera yaterensis, commonly known as the Yaterén bursera, is a shrub or small tree native to Mexico. It belongs to the Burseraceae family, which includes frankincense and myrrh trees. The plant is characterized by its smooth, gray bark and pinnately compound leaves. It produces small, yellowish-green flowers followed by spherical, woody fruits. Bursera yaterensis is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it a resilient species in tropical and subtropical regions.
